page.title: 08Farming-Beef-Sheep-Silage
page.content: Beef cattle are reared for secondary income on most farms.Some barley is grown on lower land,the grain for fodder and straw for bedding for beef cattle.Managed grassland is used for grazing.In summer silage is cut for winter feed.Hay is less important now because it is so often damaged by wet weather.Sheep are important on higher eastern land,mainly cross bred Leicester,Scottish Blackface or Rough Fell breeds.Battery hens are reared for farm-gate egg-sales and poultry meat.Market gardening produces tomatoes, cut flowers and pot plants.There is also a mushroom growing business using heated polythene tunnels.
